org.mozilla.geckoview

Class WebExtension

  • Object
    • org.mozilla.geckoview.WebExtension

  • public class WebExtension
extends Object
    Represents a WebExtension that may be used by GeckoView.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  WebExtension.Flags 
      static interface  WebExtension.MessageDelegate
      Delegates that responds to messages sent from a WebExtension.
      static class  WebExtension.MessageSender
      Describes the sender of a message from a WebExtension.
      static class  WebExtension.Port
      Port object that can be used for bidirectional communication with a WebExtension.
      static interface  WebExtension.PortDelegate
      Delegate that handles communication from a WebExtension on a specific WebExtension.Port instance.

    • Field Detail

      • location

        @NonNull
public final String location
        file: or resource: URI that points to the install location of this WebExtension. When the WebExtension is included with the APK the file can be specified using the resource://android alias. E.g. 
        
      resource://android/assets/web_extensions/my_webextension/
        Will point to folder /assets/web_extensions/my_webextension/ in the APK.

      • id

        @NonNull
public final String id
        Unique identifier for this WebExtension

      • flags

        public final long flags
        WebExtension.Flags for this WebExtension.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WebExtension

        public WebExtension(@NonNull
                    String location,
                    @NonNull
                    String id,
                    long flags)
        Builds a WebExtension instance that can be loaded in GeckoView using GeckoRuntime.registerWebExtension(org.mozilla.geckoview.WebExtension)
        Parameters:
        location - The WebExtension install location. It must be either a resource: URI to a folder inside the APK or a file: URL to a .xpi file.
        id - Unique identifier for this WebExtension. This identifier must either be a GUID or a string formatted like an email address. E.g. 
        
              "extensionname@example.org"
              "{daf44bf7-a45e-4450-979c-91cf07434c3d}"
        See also:
        • WebExtensions/manifest.json/browser_specific_settings
        • WebExtensions/WebExtensions_and_the_Add-on_ID
        flags - WebExtension.Flags for this WebExtension.

      • WebExtension

        public WebExtension(@NonNull
                    String location)
        Builds a WebExtension instance that can be loaded in GeckoView using GeckoRuntime.registerWebExtension(org.mozilla.geckoview.WebExtension) The id for this web extension will be automatically generated. All messaging from the web extension will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        location - The WebExtension install location. It must be either a resource: URI to a folder inside the APK or a file: URL to a .xpi file.

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • setMessageDelegate

        @UiThread
public void setMessageDelegate(@Nullable
                                         WebExtension.MessageDelegate messageDelegate,
                                         @NonNull
                                         String nativeApp)
        Defines the message delegate for a Native App. This message delegate will receive messages from the background script for the native app specified in nativeApp. For messages from content scripts, set a session-specific message delegate using GeckoSession.setMessageDelegate(org.mozilla.geckoview.WebExtension, org.mozilla.geckoview.WebExtension.MessageDelegate, java.lang.String). See also WebExtensions/Native_messaging
        Parameters:
        messageDelegate - handles messaging between the WebExtension and the app. To send a message from the WebExtension use the runtime.sendNativeMessage WebExtension API: E.g. 
        
        browser.runtime.sendNativeMessage(nativeApp,
              {message: "Hello from WebExtension!"});
        For bidirectional communication, use runtime.connectNative. E.g. in a content script: 
        
          let port = browser.runtime.connectNative(nativeApp);
          port.onMessage.addListener(message => {
              console.log("Message received from app");
          });
          port.postMessage("Ping from WebExtension");
        The code above will trigger a WebExtension.MessageDelegate.onConnect(org.mozilla.geckoview.WebExtension.Port) call that will contain the corresponding WebExtension.Port object that can be used to send messages to the WebExtension. Note: the nativeApp specified in the WebExtension needs to match the nativeApp parameter of this method. You can unset the message delegate by setting a null messageDelegate.
        nativeApp - which native app id this message delegate will handle messaging for. Needs to match the application parameter of runtime.sendNativeMessage and runtime.connectNative.
        See Also:
        GeckoSession.setMessageDelegate(org.mozilla.geckoview.WebExtension, org.mozilla.geckoview.WebExtension.MessageDelegate, java.lang.String)
